intro: Platanthera ovatilabris, commonly known as the ovate-lipped twayblade, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant with slender, grass-like leaves and a single, showy orchid-like flower. The plant is characterized by its greenish-yellow to pale brown flowers, which have a distinctive ovate lip. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wet meadows. Platanthera ovatilabris is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in nutrient-rich soils.
